text: Donald Howard Sutton (April 2, 1945 â€“ January 18, 2021) was an American professional baseball pitcher and broadcaster. He played in Major League Baseball (MLB) from 1966 to 1988. He played for the Los Angeles Dodgers, Houston Astros, Milwaukee Brewers, Oakland Athletics, and California Angels. He was born in Clio, Alabama. In 1998, Sutton was honored in the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum. Sutton died on January 18, 2021 in Rancho Mirage, California from cancer, aged 75. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in California Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:Houston Astros players Category:Milwaukee Brewers players Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:California Angels players Category:Sportspeople from Alabama
title: Don Sutton
